p: Furthermore, we hypothesized that SIRT1 would up-regulate through the phosphorylation of GAPDH. GAPDH and SIRT1 expression, when treated with either CHP or CHL, confirmed that both extracts could reduce the glucose level in cells. Figure 10b showed the underlying mechanisms of both extracts. Low cellular glucose significantly increased the phosphorylation of GAPDH and SIRT1 expression. When cellular glucose decreased, GAPDH became a critical enzyme and was phosphorylated by AMP-activated protein kinase (AMPK), thus triggering SIRT1 activation. This process was necessary to protect cells from glucose starvation, such as autophagy and gluconeogenesis [ 120]. Results from the Western blot showed the association of SIRT1 and cyclin. These results are consistent previous studies, that is, down-regulated SIRT1 was arrested in the G1 phase via cyclin D1 signaling [ 121, 122].
